titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lafayette Social of Brooklyn records 1987.004
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:22 +0000.

did.abstract: The Lafayette Social of Brooklyn, N.Y. was a social club founded in 1878. The collection contains a record book, constitution and bylaws, list of members, minutes, treasurer's reports, resignation letters, and correspondence.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lafayette Social of Brooklyn records, 1987.004, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1987.

controlaccess.subject: Clubs -- New York (State) -- Kings County
controlaccess.geogname: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
